concepts.name: Solving One-Step Equations
concepts.description: Techniques for solving linear equations using addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division to isolate the variable.

concepts.name: Linear Equations
concepts.description: Equations in which each term is either a constant or the product of a constant and a single variable.

concepts.name: Two-Step Equations
concepts.description: Equations that require two operations to isolate the variable, often involving combining like terms.

concepts.name: Solving Multi-Step Equations
concepts.description: Combining multiple algebraic operations such as distributing and collecting like terms to solve equations.

concepts.name: Equations with Variables on Both Sides
concepts.description: Techniques to solve equations where variables appear on both sides by simplifying and isolating the variable.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Equations
concepts.description: Modeling and solving practical problems, such as calculating costs, distances, and rates using linear equations.

concepts.name: Ratios and Proportions
concepts.description: Using ratios to compare quantities and solve problems involving proportional relationships.

concepts.name: Cross Products
concepts.description: A method to solve proportions by multiplying across the equal sign to eliminate fractions.

concepts.name: Using Scale and Indirect Measurement
concepts.description: Applying geometric similarity and scale to measure real-world objects indirectly.

concepts.name: Percent Problems
concepts.description: Calculating percentages, percent changes, and solving related real-world problems like discounts and markups.

concepts.name: Problem-Solving Strategies
concepts.description: Using structured approaches such as writing equations and checking results to solve mathematical problems.
